content: the happy apple finished measurements approximately 4 inches wide and 4 5 inches tall including stem and leaf this may vary slightly depending on yarn and gauge materials size 4 5 mm hook / us size 7 worsted weight yarn red green and light brown/tan polyfill pair of 10 mm safety eyes scissors black embroidery floss straight pins optional yarn needle stitch marker abbreviations r round sts stitches single_crochet single_crochet decrease decrease st stitch notes the pattern is worked in continuous rounds mark each round with a stitch marker so you know where it ends the straight pins are helpful for pinning the pieces together for easier sewing for the decrease you can use whichever method you prefer however i recommend the invisible decrease o hook into the front loop only of the next two stiches yarn over and pull through two loops yarn over again to complete the stitch 1 the pattern main part of apple round 1 using red yarn 6 single_crochet into magic_ring mark with a stitch marker and close ring 6 sts r2 single_crochet into each stitch around 12 sts r3 *1 single_crochet 2 single_crochet into same st* repeat around 18 sts r4 *2 single_crochet 2sc into each st* repeat around 24 sts r5 *3sc 2 single_crochet into same st* repeat around 30 sts r6 *4sc 2sc into same st* repeat around 36 sts r7 *5sc 2sc into same st* repeat around 42 sts r8-15 single_crochet around 42 sts r16 *5sc decrease* repeat around 36 sts r17 *4 single_crochet decrease* repeat around 30 sts r18 *3sc decrease* repeat around 24 sts r19 *2sc decrease* repeat around 18 sts add safety eyes and stitch mouth place eyes with about 5 or 6 stitches between them between row 13 and 14 start stuffing with polyfill and stuff as you go for the remaining rounds r20 *1 single_crochet decrease* repeat around 12 sts r21 decrease around 6 sts fasten_off with a long tail and close piece to create the apple shape close top with a drawstring by weaving the yarn needle in and out of the remaining 6 sts then pull through to tighten then with the tail pull it down through the body of the apple and out the magic_ring pull tight until small indent is formed at the top and bottom and tie a knot to secure hide the remaining tail inside stem r1 with tan/light brown yarn 3 single_crochet into magic_ring 3 sts r2 2 single_crochet into each st around 6 sts r3 in back loops only single_crochet around 6 sts 2 r4 decrease 3 times 3 sts r5 single_crochet around 3 sts fasten_off and leave tail for sewing leaf r1 with green yarn 6 single_crochet into magic_ring 6 sts r2 6 single_crochet around 6 sts r3 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 sts r4-6 single_crochet around 12 sts r7 decrease around 6 sts fasten_off and leave long tail for sewing to finish using straight pins place stem on top of apple and pin leaf
